page.description: Disables the main Alpha Five program window.

item.name: Browses (for <OBJECT> use either the <BROWSE> pointer or the name of the browse)
Forms (for <OBJECT> use either the <FORM> pointer or the name of the form)
Form Controls (for <OBJECT> use the <CONTROL> pointer or the address of the control)

section.description: The <OBJECT>.DISABLE() method makes the object unable to receive focus. The method also works for child objects on forms and may gray them. Limitations: Desktop applications only.

section.title: Example
section.description: The following script on the OnDepart event for the PayMethod field on a form disables the CreditCard field if the payment method was not "Credit Card":
section.example: if (PayMethod.value <> "Credit Card") then CreditCard.disable() else CreditCard.enable() end if

page.original:
&ltOBJECT>.DISABLE() Syntax &ltOBJECT>.DISABLE() Form_Name.DISABLE() Description The &ltOBJECT>.DISABLE() method applies to:
Alpha Anywhere (for &ltOBJECT> use the keyword "A5")
Browses (for &ltOBJECT> use either the &ltBROWSE> pointer or the name of the browse)
Forms (for &ltOBJECT> use either the &ltFORM> pointer or the name of the form)
Form Controls (for &ltOBJECT> use the &ltCONTROL> pointer or the address of the control) The &ltOBJECT>.DISABLE() method makes the object unable to receive focus. The method also works for child objects on forms and may gray them. Limitations Desktop applications only. Example The following script on the OnDepart event for the PayMethod field on a form disables the CreditCard field if the payment method was not "Credit Card": if (PayMethod.value &lt> "Credit Card") then CreditCard.disable() else CreditCard.enable() end if
See Also Form Functions and Methods, Browse Functions and Methods
